# Twitter Sentiment Analysis System

A machine learningâ€“based Sentiment Analysis system that classifies tweets into Positive, Negative, or Neutral sentiments using Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques and Logistic Regression. The project includes data preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and deployment using Streamlit.

## Project Overview

Social media platforms like Twitter generate massive amounts of unstructured text data. This project analyzes tweet sentiment to help understand public opinion, customer feedback, and social trends.

The model is trained on a real-world Twitter dataset containing tweet text and sentiment labels.

## Key Features

- Twitter-specific text preprocessing (URLs, mentions, hashtags removal)
- TF-IDF feature extraction
- Logistic Regression classifier
- Handles missing and noisy text data
- Real-time sentiment prediction via Streamlit web app
- Supports Positive, Negative, and Neutral sentiment classes

## Tech Stack

- Programming Language: Python  
- Libraries: Pandas, NumPy, NLTK, Scikit-learn  
- NLP Techniques: Tokenization, Stopword Removal, Lemmatization  
- Model: Logistic Regression  
- Deployment: Streamlit
